longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to render unlawful certain kinds of sex discrimination, discrimination on the ground of marital status, pregnancy or breastfeeding, sexual harassment and harassment of breastfeeding women; to provide for the establishment of a Commission with the functions of working towards the elimination of such discrimination and harassment and promoting equality of opportunity between men and women generally; and to provide for matters incidental thereto or connected therewith.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Sex Discrimination Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: access (獲得、享用) means access as construed in accordance with section 56;
act (作為) includes a deliberate omission;

def.name: Advertisement
def.leadIn: advertisement (廣告) includes every form of advertisement, whether to the public or not, and whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a newspaper or other publication;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by television or radio;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by display of notices, signs, labels, showcards or goods;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by distribution of samples, circulars, catalogues, price lists or other material;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by exhibition of pictures, models or films; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in any other way,

def.continued: and references to the publishing of advertisements shall be construed accordingly;

subsection.def: breastfeeding (餵哺母乳) means breastfeeding within the meaning of section 8A(2)(a); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 4)
Chairperson (主席) means the Chairperson of the Commission appointed under section 63(3)(a);

club (會社) means an association, incorporate or unincorporate, of not less than 30 persons associated together for social, literary, cultural, political, sporting, athletic or other lawful purposes and which provides and maintains its facilities, in whole or in part, from the funds of the association; (Amended 29 of 2008 s. 91)
Commission (委員會) means the Equal Opportunities Commission established under section 63(1);
commission agent (佣金經紀人) means commission agent as construed in accordance with section 20;
committee (小組委員會) means a committee established under section 64(2)(a);
committee of management (管理委員會), in relation to a club, means the group or body of persons (howsoever described) that manages the affairs of that club;
conciliator (調停人) means any person engaged by the Commission under section 64(2)(e); (Amended 15 of 2012 s. 11)
contract worker (合約工作者) means contract worker as construed in accordance with section 13;
discrimination (歧視) means any discrimination falling within section 5, 6, 7, 8, 8A or 9, and related expressions shall be construed accordingly; (Amended 8 of 2020 s. 4)
dynamically supported craft (藉動力而獲得支承的航行器) has the same meaning as in the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313); (Amended L.N. 315 of 1998)
education (敎育) includes any form of training or instruction;
educational establishment (敎育機構) means an educational establishment specified in column 1 of Schedule 1;

def.name: Employment

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a contract of service or of apprenticeship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contract personally to execute any work or labour,

def.continued: and related expressions shall be construed accordingly;

subsection.def: enforcement notice (執行通知) means a notice under section 77(2);
estate agent (地產代理) has the same meaning as in the Estate Agents Ordinance (Cap. 511); (Replaced 29 of 2008 s. 91)
firm (商號) means firm within the meaning of the Partnership Ordinance (Cap. 38);
formal investigation (正式調查) means an investigation under section 70;

general notice (一般通告), in relation to any person, means a notice published by him at a time and in a manner appearing to him suitable for securing that the notice is seen within a reasonable time by persons likely to be affected by it;

def.name: Harass,Harassment

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sexually harass within the meaning of subsection (5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: harass within the meaning of section 2A,

def.continued: and harassment (騷擾) is to be construed accordingly; (Added 3 of 2021 s. 4)

subsection.def: intern (實習人員)—see section 23A(2); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 19)
internship (實習)—see section 23A(2); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 19)
man (男性) includes a male of any age;

def.name: MaritalStatus
def.leadIn: marital status (婚姻狀況) means the state or condition of being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: single;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: married;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: married but living separately and apart from one’s spouse;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: divorced; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: widowed;

def.name: NearRelative
def.leadIn: near relative (近親), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s spouse;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a parent of the person or of the spouse;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a child of the person or the spouse of such a child;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: a grandparent of the person or of the spouse; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a grandchild of the person or the spouse of such a grandchild,

def.continued: and, in determining the above relationships, children born out of wedlock are to be included, an adopted child is to be regarded as a child of both the natural parents and the adoptive parent or parents and a step child as the child of both the natural parents and any step parent; (Added 29 of 2008 s. 91)

subsection.def: notice (通告、通知) means a notice in writing;
prescribed (訂明) means prescribed in rules made under section 88;
profession (專業) includes any vocation or occupation;
pupillage (見習職位)—see section 36(4); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 19)
retirement (退休) includes retirement (whether voluntary or not) on grounds of age, length of service or incapacity;
sex discrimination (性別歧視) means any discrimination falling within section 5 or 6;
single-sex establishment (單性別機構) means single-sex establishment as construed in accordance with section 26;
trade (行業) includes any business;
training (訓練) includes any form of education or instruction;
volunteer (義工)—see section 23A(2); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 19)
woman (女性) includes a female of any age.

subsection.leadIn: References in this Ordinance to the dismissal of a person from employment or to the expulsion of a person from a position as partner include references—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the termination of that person’s employment or partnership by the expiration of any period (including a period expiring by reference to an event or circumstance), not being a termination immediately after which the employment or partnership is renewed on the same terms;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the termination of that person’s employment or partnership by any act of his (including the giving of notice) in circumstances such that he is entitled to terminate it without notice by reason of the conduct of the employer, or the other partners, as the case may be.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, an enforcement notice or a finding by the District Court becomes final when an appeal against the notice or finding is dismissed, withdrawn or abandoned or when the time for appealing expires without an appeal having been brought; and for this purpose an appeal against an enforcement notice shall be taken to be dismissed if, notwithstanding that a requirement of the notice is quashed on appeal, a direction is given in respect of it under section 78(3).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person (howsoever described) sexually harasses a woman if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: makes an unwelcome sexual advance, or an unwelcome request for sexual favours, to her; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: engages in other unwelcome conduct of a sexual nature in relation to her,

paragraph.continued: in circumstances in which a reasonable person, having regard to all the circumstances, would have anticipated that she would be offended, humiliated or intimidated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person, alone or together with other persons, engages in conduct of a sexual nature which creates a hostile or intimidating environment for her. (Amended 29 of 2008 s. 91)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (5)—
subsection.def: conduct of a sexual nature (涉及性的行徑) includes making a statement of a sexual nature to a woman, or in her presence, whether the statement is made orally or in writing.

subsection.content: A provision of Part 3 or 4 framed with reference to harassment of women shall be treated as applying equally to the treatment of men and for that purpose that provision, and subsections (5) and (7), shall have effect with such modifications as are necessary. (Amended 3 of 2021 s. 4)

subsection.name: 8A
subsection.content: Subsection (8) does not apply to a provision of Part 3 or 4 framed with reference to harassment of women if the harassment is harassment within the meaning of section 2A. (Added 3 of 2021 s. 4)

def.name: ExistingStatutoryProvision
def.leadIn: Subject to subsection (10), in this Ordinance existing statutory provision (現有法例條文) means any provision of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any subsidiary legislation made—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under an Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: before, on or after the enactment of this Ordinance. (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 95)

subsection.content: Where an Ordinance enacted after this Ordinance was enacted re-enacts (with or without modifications) a provision of an Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted, then that provision as re-enacted shall be treated for the purposes of subsection (9) as if it continued to be contained in an Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance (other than section 2(5)), a person harasses a woman if, on the ground that the woman is breastfeeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person engages in unwelcome conduct, in circumstances in which a reasonable person, having regard to all the circumstances, would have anticipated that the woman would be offended, humiliated or intimidated by that conduct; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person, alone or together with other persons, engages in conduct that creates a hostile or intimidating environment for the woman.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: conduct (行徑) includes making a statement to a woman or in her presence, whether the statement is made orally or in writing.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Act done because of sex, etc. and for other reason

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an act is done for 2 or more reasons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: one of the reasons is—

subparagraph.content: a person’s sex;
a person’s marital status;
a woman’s pregnancy; or
that a woman is breastfeeding,

paragraph.continued: whether or not it is the dominant or a substantial reason, (Replaced 8 of 2020 s. 5)

section.continued: then, for the purpose of this Ordinance, the act shall be taken to be done for the reason specified in paragraph (b).

subsection.leadIn: A person discriminates against a woman in any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the ground of her sex he treats her less favourably than he treats or would treat a man; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: he applies to her a requirement or condition which he applies or would apply equally to a man but—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: which is such that the proportion of women who can comply with it is considerably smaller than the proportion of men who can comply with it;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which he cannot show to be justifiable irrespective of the sex of the person to whom it is applied; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: which is to her detriment because she cannot comply with it.

subsection.content: If a person treats or would treat a man differently according to the man’s marital status, his treatment of a woman is for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) to be compared to his treatment of a man having the like marital status.

Section 5, and the provisions of Parts 3 and 4 relating to sex discrimination against women, shall be read as applying equally to the treatment of men, and for that purpose shall have effect with such modifications as are necessary.
In the application of subsection (1) no account shall be taken of special treatment afforded to women in connection with pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding. (Amended 8 of 2020 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: A person discriminates against a person of either sex in any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of Part 3 or 4 if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the ground of his or her marital status (the relevant marital status) he treats that person less favourably than he treats or would treat a person of the same sex with a different marital status; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: he applies to that person a requirement or condition which he applies or would apply equally to a person with a different marital status but—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: which is such that the proportion of persons with the relevant marital status who can comply with it is considerably smaller than the proportion of persons of the same sex with a different marital status who can comply with it;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which he cannot show to be justifiable irrespective of the marital status of the person to whom it is applied; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: which is to that person’s detriment because he or she cannot comply with it.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), a provision of Part 3 or 4 framed with reference to discrimination against women shall be treated as applying equally to the treatment of men, and for that purpose shall have effect with such modifications as are necessary.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Discrimination against pregnant women
section.leadIn: A person discriminates against a woman in any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of Part 3 or 4 if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the ground of her pregnancy he treats her less favourably than he treats or would treat a person who is not pregnant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: he applies to her a requirement or condition which he applies or would apply to a person who is not pregnant but—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: which he cannot show to be justifiable irrespective of whether or not the person to whom it is applied is pregnant; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: which is to her detriment because she cannot comply with it.

subsection.leadIn: A person (the discriminator) discriminates against a woman in any circumstances relevant for the purposes of Part 3 or 4 if the discriminator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the ground that the woman is breastfeeding, treats the woman less favourably than the discriminator treats or would treat a person who is not breastfeeding; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: applies to the woman, who is breastfeeding, a requirement or condition that the discriminator applies or would apply to a person who is not breastfeeding and the requirement or condition—

subparagraph.content: is one that the discriminator cannot show to be justifiable, irrespective of whether the person to whom it is applied is a woman who is breastfeeding; and
is to the detriment of the woman who is breastfeeding because she cannot comply with it.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a woman is breastfeeding if she—

subparagraph.content: is engaged in the act of breastfeeding a child or expressing breast milk; or
is a person who feeds a child with her breast milk; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who is not breastfeeding is to be construed accordingly.

def.name: TheDiscriminator,ThePersonVictimised
def.leadIn: A person (the discriminator) discriminates against another person (the person victimised) in any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance if he treats the person victimised less favourably than in those circumstances he treats or would treat other persons, and does so by reason that the person victimised or any other person (the third person) has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: brought proceedings against the discriminator or any other person under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: given evidence or information in connection with proceedings brought by any person against the discriminator or any other person under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise done anything under or by reference to this Ordinance in relation to the discriminator or any other person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: alleged that the discriminator or any other person has committed an act which (whether or not the allegation so states) would amount to a contravention of this Ordinance,

def.continued: or by reason that the discriminator knows the person victimised or the third person, as the case may be, intends to do any of those things, or suspects the person victimised or the third person, as the case may be, has done, or intends to do, any of them.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not apply to treatment of a person by reason of any allegation made by him if the allegation was false and not made in good faith.

For the purposes of subsection (1), a provision of Part 3 or 4 framed with reference to discrimination against, or harassment of, women shall be treated as applying equally to the treatment of men and for that purpose shall have effect with such modifications as are necessary. (Amended 3 of 2021 s. 6)
Subsection (3) does not apply to a provision of Part 3 or 4 framed with reference to harassment of women if the harassment is harassment within the meaning of section 2A. (Added 3 of 2021 s. 6)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Comparison of cases under sections 5(1), 7(1) and 8
section.leadIn: A comparison of the cases of persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of different sex under section 5(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of different marital status under section 7(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: who are pregnant and not pregnant under section 8,

section.continued: shall be such that the relevant circumstances in the one case are the same, or not materially different, in the other.

section.name: s10A
section.heading: Comparison of cases under section 8A
section.leadIn: A comparison of the cases under section 8A of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a woman who is breastfeeding; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who is not breastfeeding,

section.continued: must be such that the relevant circumstances in the one case are the same as, or not materially different from, those in the other.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Discrimination and Harassment in Employment Field

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person, in relation to employment by him at an establishment in Hong Kong, to discriminate against a woman—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the arrangements he makes for the purpose of determining who should be offered that employment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms on which he offers her that employment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to offer her that employment.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person, in the case of a woman employed by him at an establishment in Hong Kong, to discriminate against her—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the terms of employment he affords her; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by dismissing her, or subjecting her to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Except in relation to discrimination falling within section 9, subsections (1) and (2) shall not apply to employment where the number of persons employed by the employer, added to the number employed by any associated employers of his, does not exceed 5 (disregarding any persons employed for the purposes of a private home).

Subject to subsection (5), subsections (1)(b) and (2) shall not apply to provision in relation to death or retirement made for a woman before 15 October 1997 in so far as any such provision continues for that woman on and after that date. (Replaced 71 of 1997 s. 2. Amended 136 of 1997 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1)(b) and (2) shall apply to provision in relation to death or retirement of the kind mentioned in subsection (4) in so far as, in their application to such provision in relation to retirement, they render it unlawful for a person to discriminate against a woman—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in such of the terms on which he offers her employment as make provision in relation to the way in which he will afford her access to opportunities for promotion, transfer or training or as provide for her dismissal or demotion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the way he affords her opportunities for promotion, transfer or training or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford her access to any such opportunities; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by dismissing her or subjecting her to any detriment which results in her dismissal or consists in or involves her demotion. (Replaced 71 of 1997 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) shall not apply to benefits, facilities or services of any description if the employer is concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of benefits, facilities or services of that description to the public, or to a section of the public comprising the woman concerned, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that provision differs in a material respect from the provision of the benefits, facilities or services by the employer to his employees; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the benefits, facilities or services relate to training.

subsection.content: Subsection (3) shall expire on the 3rd anniversary of the day on which this Ordinance is enacted.

For the purposes of subsection (3), 2 employers are to be treated as associated if one is a company of which the other (directly or indirectly) has control or if both are companies of which a third person (directly or indirectly) has control.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette— (Amended 66 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend subsection (3) by substituting another number for the last number appearing in that subsection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend subsection (7) by substituting another anniversary for the anniversary appearing in that subsection.

editorialNote.content: * Prior to its amendment by 136 of 1997, this subsection disapplies certain provisions of this Ordinance to certain death or retirement provision made before “the commencement of this section” in so far as that death or retirement provision continues “on and after that commencement”. According to s. 5 of 136 of 1997, “the commencement of this section” meant, and always meant, for all purposes, the commencement of ss. 2, 3 and 4 of 71 of 1997, i.e. 15 October 1997.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Exception where sex is genuine occupational qualification

subsection.leadIn: In relation to sex discrimination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 11(1)(a) or (c) shall not apply to any employment where being a man is a genuine occupational qualification for the job;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 11(2)(a) shall not apply to opportunities for promotion or transfer to, or training for, such employment.

subsection.leadIn: Being a man is a genuine occupational qualification for a job only where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the essential nature of the job calls for a man for reasons of physiology (excluding physical strength or stamina) or, in dramatic performances or other entertainment, for reasons of authenticity, so that the essential nature of the job would be materially different if carried out by a woman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the job needs to be held by a man to preserve decency or privacy because—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is likely to involve physical contact with men in circumstances where they might reasonably object to its being carried out by a woman; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the holder of the job is likely to do his work in circumstances where men might reasonably object to the presence of a woman because they are in a state of undress or are using sanitary facilities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the job is likely to involve the holder of the job doing his work, or living, in a private home and needs to be held by a man because objection might reasonably be taken to allowing to a woman—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the degree of physical or social contact with a person living in the home; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the knowledge of intimate details of such a person’s life,

paragraph.continued: which is likely, because of the nature or circumstances of the job or of the home, to be allowed to, or available to, the holder of the job;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the nature or location of the establishment makes it impracticable for the holder of the job to live elsewhere than in premises provided by the employer, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the only such premises which are available for persons holding that kind of job are lived in, or normally lived in, by men and are not equipped with separate sleeping accommodation for women and sanitary facilities which could be used by women in privacy from men; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is not reasonable to expect the employer to equip those premises with such accommodation and facilities or to provide other premises for women;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the nature of the establishment, or of the part of it within which the work is done, requires the job to be held by a man because—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is, or is part of, a hospital, prison or other establishment for persons requiring special care, supervision or attention;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: those persons are all men (disregarding any woman whose presence is exceptional); and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: it is reasonable, having regard to the essential character of the establishment or that part, that the job should not be held by a woman;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the holder of the job provides individuals with personal services promoting their welfare or education, or similar personal services, and those services can most effectively be provided by a man;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the job needs to be held by a man because it is likely to involve the performance of duties outside Hong Kong in a place the laws or customs of which are such that the duties could not, or could not effectively, be performed by a woman; or

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the job is one of 2 to be held by a married couple.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) applies where some only of the duties of the job fall within any paragraph of that subsection (except paragraph (i)) as well as where all of them do.

subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (a), (b), (d), (e), (f) or (h) of subsection (2) shall not apply in relation to the filling of a vacancy at a time when the employer already has male employees— (Amended 18 of 2014 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who are capable of carrying out the duties falling within that paragraph;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whom it would be reasonable to employ on those duties; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whose numbers are sufficient to meet the employer’s likely requirements in respect of those duties without undue inconvenience. (Amended 18 of 2014 s. 14)

subsection.content: This section applies to any work for a person (the principal) which is available for doing by individuals (contract workers) who are employed not by the principal himself but by a contractor or sub-contractor of the principal. (Amended 29 of 2008 s. 92)

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which this section applies, to discriminate against a woman who is a contract worker—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which he allows her to do that work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by not allowing her to do it or continue to do it;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the way he affords her access to any benefits, facilities or services or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford her access to them; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by subjecting her to any other detriment.

subsection.content: The principal does not contravene subsection (2)(b) by doing any act in relation to a woman at a time when if the work were to be done by a person taken into his employment being a man would be a genuine occupational qualification for the job.

Subsection (2)(c) shall not apply to benefits, facilities or services of any description if the principal is concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of benefits, facilities or services of that description to the public, or to a section of the public to which the woman belongs, unless that provision differs in a material respect from the provision of the benefits, facilities or services by the principal to his contract workers.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: contractor (承判商) means a person who undertakes any work for the principal under a contract that is entered into by the person directly with the principal;

sub-contractor (次承判商) means a person who enters into a contract with another person (whether or not a contractor of the principal) to undertake all or any part of the work that a contractor of the principal has undertaken. (Added 29 of 2008 s. 92)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Meaning of employment at establishment in Hong Kong

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance (the relevant purposes), employment is to be regarded as being at an establishment in Hong Kong unless the employee does his work wholly or mainly outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employment on board a ship registered in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: employment on aircraft or dynamically supported craft registered in Hong Kong and operated by a person who has his principal place of business, or is ordinarily resident, in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: but for the relevant purposes such employment is to be regarded as being at an establishment in Hong Kong unless the employee does his work wholly outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: In the case of employment on board a ship registered in Hong Kong (except where the employee does his work wholly outside Hong Kong) the ship shall for the relevant purposes be deemed to be the establishment.

Where work is not done at an establishment it shall be treated for the relevant purposes as done at the establishment from which it is done or (where it is not done from any establishment) at the establishment with which it has the closest connection.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a firm consisting of not less than 6 partners, in relation to a position as partner in the firm, to discriminate against a woman—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the arrangements the firm makes for the purpose of determining who should be offered that position;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the firm offers her that position;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to offer her that position; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in a case where the woman already holds that position—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the way the firm affords her access to any benefits, facilities or services, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford her access to them; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by expelling her from that position or subjecting her to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall apply in relation to persons proposing to form themselves into a partnership as it applies in relation to a firm.
Subsection (1)(a) and (c) shall not apply to a position as partner where, if it were employment, being a man would be a genuine occupational qualification for the job.

Subject to subsection (5), subsection (1)(b) and (d) shall not apply to provision in relation to death or retirement made for a woman before 15 October 1997 in so far as any such provision continues for that woman on and after that date. (Replaced 71 of 1997 s. 3. Amended 136 of 1997 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(b) and (d) shall apply to provision made in relation to death or retirement of the kind mentioned in subsection (4) in so far as, in their application to such provision made in relation to retirement, they render it unlawful for a firm to discriminate against a woman—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in such of the terms on which the firm offers her a position as partner as provide for her expulsion from that position; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by expelling her from a position as partner or subjecting her to any detriment which results in her expulsion from such a position. (Replaced 71 of 1997 s. 3)

subsection.content: In the case of a limited partnership references in subsection (1) to a partner shall be construed as references to a general partner within the meaning of section 2 of the Limited Partnerships Ordinance (Cap. 37).

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette, amend subsection (1) by— (Amended 66 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: substituting another number for the number appearing in that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: repealing the words and number appearing after “for a firm” and before “, in relation to”.

editorialNote.content: * Prior to its amendment by 136 of 1997, this subsection disapplies certain provisions of this Ordinance to certain death or retirement provision made before “the commencement of this section” in so far as that death or retirement provision continues “on and after that commencement”. According to s. 5 of 136 of 1997, “the commencement of this section” meant, and always meant, for all purposes, the commencement of ss. 2, 3 and 4 of 71 of 1997, i.e. 15 October 1997.

subsection.content: This section applies to an organization of workers, an organization of employers, or any other organization whose members carry on a particular profession or trade for the purposes of which the organization exists.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an organization to which this section applies, in the case of a woman who is not a member of the organization, to discriminate against her—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which it is prepared to admit her to membership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting to accept, her application for membership.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an organization to which this section applies, in the case of a woman who is a member of the organization, to discriminate against her—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the way it affords her access to any benefits, facilities or services, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford her access to them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by depriving her of membership, or varying the terms on which she is a member; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by subjecting her to any other detriment.

subsection.content: This section shall not apply to provision in relation to the death or retirement from work of a member made before 15 October 1997 in so far as any such provision continues for that member on and after that date. (Replaced 71 of 1997 s. 4. Amended 136 of 1997 s. 4)

editorialNote.content: * Prior to its amendment by 136 of 1997, this subsection disapplies certain provisions of this Ordinance to certain death or retirement provision made before “the commencement of this section” in so far as that death or retirement provision continues “on and after that commencement”. According to s. 5 of 136 of 1997, “the commencement of this section” meant, and always meant, for all purposes, the commencement of ss. 2, 3 and 4 of 71 of 1997, i.e. 15 October 1997.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an authority or body which can confer an authorization or qualification which is needed for, or facilitates, engagement in a particular profession or trade to discriminate against a woman—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which it is prepared to confer on her that authorization or qualification;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to grant her application for it; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by withdrawing it from her or varying the terms on which she holds it.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authority or body is required by law to satisfy itself as to his good character before conferring on a person an authorization or qualification which is needed for, or facilitates, his engagement in any profession or trade then, without prejudice to any other duty to which it is subject, that requirement shall be taken to impose on the authority or body a duty to have regard to any evidence tending to show that he, or any of his employees or agents (whether past or present), has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: practised unlawful discrimination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: engaged in unlawful harassment, (Amended 3 of 2021 s. 12)

subsection.continued: in, or in connection with, the carrying on of any profession or trade.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not apply to discrimination which is rendered unlawful by section 25.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorization or qualification (授權或資格) includes recognition, licensing, registration, enrolment, approval and certification;
confer (授予) includes renew or extend.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Persons concerned with provision of vocational training

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful, in the case of a woman seeking or undergoing training which would help fit her for any employment, for any person who provides, or makes arrangements for the provision of, facilities for such training to discriminate against her—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which that person affords her access to any training course or other facilities concerned with such training;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford her such access;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by terminating her training; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by subjecting her to any other detriment during the course of her training.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: discrimination which is rendered unlawful by any of the provisions of section 11(1) or (2) or 25; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: discrimination which would be rendered unlawful by any of those provisions but for the operation of any other provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an employment agency to discriminate against a woman—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the agency offers to provide any of its services;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to provide any of its services; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the way it provides any of its services.

subsection.content: References in subsection (1) to the services of an employment agency include guidance on careers and any other services related to employment.
This section shall not apply if the discrimination only concerns employment which the employer could lawfully refuse to offer the woman.

subsection.leadIn: An employment agency shall not be subject to any liability under this section if it proves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that it acted in reliance on a statement made to it by the employer to the effect that, by reason of the operation of subsection (3), its action would not be unlawful; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it was reasonable for it to rely on the statement.

subsection.content: A person who knowingly or recklessly makes a statement of the kind referred to in subsection (4)(a) which in a material respect is false or misleading commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

This section applies to any work for a person (the principal) which is available for doing by individuals (commission agents) as the agents of the principal and who are remunerated, whether in whole or in part, by commission.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which this section applies, to discriminate against a woman who is a commission agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which he allows her to do that work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by not allowing her to do it or continue to do it;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the way he affords her access to any benefits, facilities or services or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford her access to them; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by subjecting her to any other detriment.

subsection.content: The principal does not contravene subsection (2)(b) by doing any act in relation to a woman at a time when if the work were to be done by a person taken into his employment being a man would be a genuine occupational qualification for the job.

Subsection (2)(c) shall not apply to benefits, facilities or services of any description if the principal is concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of benefits, facilities or services of that description to the public, or to a section of the public to which the woman belongs, unless that provision differs in a material respect from the provision of the benefits, facilities or services by the principal to his commission agents.

Subject to subsection (2), without prejudice to the operation of the other provisions of this Part in relation to the Government, it is unlawful for the Government to discriminate against a woman in the performance of its functions or the exercise of its powers.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not render unlawful—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as regards a woman not having the right to enter and remain in Hong Kong, any act done under any immigration legislation governing entry into, stay in and departure from Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any act done in relation to a woman if it was necessary for that act to be done in order to comply with a requirement of an existing statutory provision.

subsection.content: Nothing in this Part applies to employment for the purposes of an organized religion where the employment is limited to one sex so as to comply with the doctrines of the religion or to avoid offending the religious susceptibilities common to its followers.

Nothing in section 17 applies to an authorization or qualification (within the meaning of that section) for the purposes of an organized religion where the authorization or qualification is limited to one sex so as to comply with the doctrines of the religion or to avoid offending the religious susceptibilities common to its followers.
It is unlawful for a person, in relation to employment by him at an establishment in Hong Kong, to harass a woman who is seeking to be employed by the person.
It is unlawful for a person, in the case of a woman employed by him at an establishment in Hong Kong, to harass her.
It is unlawful for a person who is employed by another person at an establishment in Hong Kong to harass a woman who is seeking to be, or who is, employed by that second-mentioned person.
It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which section 13 applies, to harass a woman who is a contract worker.
It is unlawful for a contract worker to harass a woman who is a fellow contract worker.
It is unlawful for a partner in a firm to harass a woman who is seeking to be, or who is, a partner in the firm.
Subsection (6) shall apply in relation to persons proposing to form themselves into a partnership as it applies in relation to a firm.
Section 15(6) shall apply to subsection (6) as it applies to section 15(1).
It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which section 20 applies, to harass a woman who is a commission agent.
It is unlawful for a commission agent to harass a woman who is a fellow commission agent.
It is unlawful for a person who is seeking to be, or who is, employed by a woman at an establishment in Hong Kong to harass her.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person residing in any premises to harass a woman— (Amended 3 of 2021 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employed by another person at an establishment in Hong Kong (and whether or not that other person also resides in those premises or those premises are that establishment); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carrying out in those premises all or part of her work in relation to her employment (and whether or not she also resides in those premises).

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a person who is a workplace participant to harass a woman who is also a workplace participant at a workplace of them both. (Amended 3 of 2021 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any other work that is usually described as an internship;

def.name: Workplace
def.leadIn: workplace (工作場所), in relation to a person, means a place—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at which the person works as a workplace participant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person attends as a workplace participant;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an employer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a contract worker;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the principal, within the meaning of section 13(1), of a contract worker;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a commission agent;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the principal, within the meaning of section 20(1), of a commission agent;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a partner in a firm;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an intern; or
a volunteer.

subsection.content:
It is unlawful for a member of an organization to which section 16 applies to
harass a woman who is seeking to be, or who is, a member of the organization.

It is unlawful for a member of an authority or body referred to in section 17 to
harass a woman seeking an authorization or qualification (within the meaning of that section) which can be conferred by the authority or body, as the case may be.

It is unlawful for a person to
harass a woman seeking or undergoing training which would help fit her for any employment if that person provides, or makes arrangements for the provision of, facilities for such training.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: operates an employment agency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a member of the staff of an employment agency,

subsection.continued:
to
harass a woman in the course of offering to provide, or providing, any of the agency’s services to her.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Discrimination and Harassment in other Fields

section.name: s25
section.heading: Discrimination by responsible bodies for educational establishments
section.leadIn: It is unlawful for the responsible body for an educational establishment to discriminate against a woman—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which it offers to admit her to the establishment as a student;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to accept an application for her admission to the establishment as a student; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where she is a student of the establishment—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: by excluding her from the establishment or subjecting her to any other detriment.

subsection.leadIn: Section 25(a) and (b) shall not apply to the admission of students to any educational establishment (single-sex establishment) which admits students of one sex only, or which would be taken to admit students of one sex only if there were disregarded students of the opposite sex—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose admission is exceptional; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose numbers are comparatively small and whose admission is confined to particular courses of instruction or teaching classes.

subsection.content: Where an educational establishment which is not a single-sex establishment has some students as boarders and others as non-boarders, and admits as boarders students of one sex only (or would be taken to admit as boarders students of one sex only if there were disregarded boarders of the opposite sex whose numbers are comparatively small), section 25(a) and (b) shall not apply to the admission of boarders and section 25(c)(i) shall not apply to boarding facilities.

Where an educational establishment is a single-sex establishment by reason of its inclusion in subsection (1)(b), the fact that students of one sex are confined to particular courses of instruction or teaching classes shall not be taken to contravene section 25(c)(i).

section.name: s27
section.heading: Exceptions for single-sex establishments turning co-educational

subsection.leadIn: Where at any time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the responsible body for an educational establishment which is a single-sex establishment determines to alter its admissions arrangements so that the establishment will cease to be a single-sex establishment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 26(2) applies to the admission of boarders to an educational establishment but the responsible body for the establishment determines to alter its admissions arrangements so that that section will cease so to apply,

subsection.continued: then the responsible body may, by notice served on the Commission, specify the date on which that determination is to take effect.

subsection.content: Where the responsible body for an educational establishment has served a notice referred to in subsection (1), then if the responsible body, at any time during the period of 3 years beginning on the date specified in that notice as the date on which the determination concerned referred to in that subsection is to take effect (or such longer period not exceeding 3 years as the Commission may allow in any particular case), refuses or deliberately omits to accept an application for the admission of a person to the establishment as a student, that refusal or omission, as the case may be, shall not be taken to contravene any provision of this Ordinance.
This section shall not operate to afford any exemption from liability under this Ordinance except as provided for in subsection (2).

section.name: s28
section.heading: Discrimination in provision of goods, facilities or services

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for any person concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of goods, facilities or services to the public or a section of the public to discriminate against a woman who seeks to obtain or use those goods, facilities or services—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to provide her with any of them; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to provide her with goods, facilities or services of the like quality, in the like manner and on the like terms as are normal in his case in relation to male members of the public or (where she belongs to a section of the public) to male members of that section.

subsection.leadIn: The following are examples of the facilities and services referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: access to and use of any place which members of the public or a section of the public are permitted to enter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accommodation in a hotel, guesthouse or other similar establishment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: facilities by way of banking or insurance or for grants, loans, credit or finance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: facilities for education;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: facilities for entertainment, recreation or refreshment;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: facilities for transport or travel;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the services of any profession or trade;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the services of—

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any department of the Government; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any undertaking by or of the Government.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that where a particular skill is commonly exercised in a different way for men and for women it shall not be a contravention of subsection (1) for a person who does not normally exercise it for women to insist on exercising it for a woman only in accordance with his normal practice or, if he reasonably considers it impracticable to do that in her case, to refuse or deliberately omit to exercise it.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Discrimination in disposal or management of premises

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person, in relation to premises in Hong Kong of which he has power to dispose, to discriminate against a woman—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which he offers her those premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing her application for those premises; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in his treatment of her in relation to any list of persons in need of premises of that description.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person, in relation to premises managed by him, to discriminate against a woman occupying the premises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the way he affords her access to any benefits or facilities, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford her access to them; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by evicting her, or subjecting her to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not apply to a person who owns an estate or interest in the premises and wholly occupies them unless he uses the services of an estate agent for the purposes of the disposal of the premises, or publishes or causes to be published an advertisement in connection with the disposal.

subsection.def: In this section in relation to premises, power to dispose (有權處置) includes the power to sell, rent, let, sub-let or otherwise part with possession of those premises.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Discrimination: consent for assignment or sub-letting

subsection.content: Where the licence or consent of the landlord or of any other person is required for the disposal to any person of premises in Hong Kong comprised in a tenancy, it is unlawful for the landlord or other person to discriminate against a woman by withholding the licence or consent for disposal of the premises to her.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person withholding a licence or consent, or a near relative of his (the relevant occupier) resides, and intends to continue to reside, on the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is on the premises, in addition to the accommodation occupied by the relevant occupier, accommodation (not being storage accommodation or means of access) shared by the relevant occupier with other persons residing on the premises who are not members of his household; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the premises are small premises as construed in accordance with section 31(2).

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that this section applies to tenancies created before the enactment of this Ordinance as well as to tenancies created on or after the enactment of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: disposal (處置), in relation to premises comprised in a tenancy, includes assignment of the tenancy and sub-letting or parting with possession of the premises or any part of the premises;

def.name: Tenancy
def.leadIn: tenancy (租賃) means a tenancy created—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a lease or sub-lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by an agreement for a lease or sub-lease;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by a tenancy agreement; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: pursuant to any enactment.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 28(1) and 29 shall not apply to the provision by a person of accommodation in any premises, or the disposal of premises by him, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person or a near relative of his (the relevant occupier) resides, and intends to continue to reside, on the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is on the premises, in addition to the accommodation occupied by the relevant occupier, accommodation (not being storage accommodation or means of access) shared by the relevant occupier with other persons residing on the premises who are not members of his household; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the premises are small premises.

subsection.leadIn: Premises shall be treated for the purposes of subsection (1) as small premises if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of premises comprising residential accommodation for one or more households (under separate letting or similar agreements) in addition to the accommodation occupied by the relevant occupier, there is not normally residential accommodation for more than 2 such households and only the relevant occupier and any member of his household reside in the accommodation occupied by him;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of premises not falling within paragraph (a), there is not normally residential accommodation on the premises for more than 6 persons in addition to the relevant occupier and any members of his household.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette, amend subsection (2)(b) by substituting another number for the number appearing in that subsection. (Amended 66 of 1999 s. 3)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Exceptions from section 28(1) for health and safety considerations
section.content: Section 28(1) shall not be construed as rendering unlawful discrimination falling within section 8 if the discrimination is imposed in order to comply with health and safety considerations which are reasonable in the circumstances.

subsection.content: This section applies to a body the activities of which are carried on otherwise than for profit.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 28(1) and 29 shall not be construed as rendering unlawful—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the restriction of membership of any body to which this section applies to persons of one sex (disregarding any minor exceptions); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provision of benefits, facilities or services to members of any body to which this section applies where the membership is so restricted,

subsection.continued: even though membership of the body is open to the public, or to a section of the public.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in section 28 or 29 shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be construed as affecting a provision to which this subsection applies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: render unlawful an act which is done in order to give effect to such a provision.

subsection.content: Subsection (3) applies to a provision for conferring benefits on persons of one sex only (disregarding any benefits to persons of the opposite sex which are exceptional or are relatively insignificant), being a provision which constitutes the main object of a body to which this section applies.

subsection.leadIn: A person who provides at any place facilities or services restricted to men does not for that reason contravene section 28(1) if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the place is (permanently or for the time being) occupied or used for the purposes of an organized religion, and the facilities or services are restricted to men so as to comply with the doctrines of that religion or to avoid offending the religious susceptibilities common to its followers; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the facilities or services are provided for, or are likely to be used by, 2 or more persons at the same time, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the facilities or services are such, or those persons are such, that male users are likely to suffer serious embarrassment at the presence of a woman; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the facilities or services are such that a user is likely to be in a state of undress and a male user might reasonably object to the presence of a female user.

subsection.content: A person who provides facilities or services restricted to men shall not for that reason contravene section 28(1) if the services or facilities are such that physical contact between the user and any other person is likely, and that other person might reasonably object if the user were a woman.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 28(1) and 29 shall not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to discrimination which is rendered unlawful by any provision or Part of this Ordinance specified in column 1 of Schedule 4; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to discrimination which would be so unlawful but for any provision or Part of this Ordinance specified in column 2 of that Schedule.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Discrimination in eligibility to vote for and to be elected or appointed to advisory bodies

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a relevant body means a public body, a public authority, a statutory advisory body, or a prescribed body.

In this section, a reference to a relevant position includes membership of a public body, a public authority, and a prescribed position, and the positions of Rural Representative or member or office-holder of a Rural Committee within the meaning of the Heung Yee Kuk Ordinance (Cap. 1097). (Amended 5 of 2014 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person to discriminate against another person in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determining the eligibility of a person to stand for election to a relevant body or relevant position, or to be selected for a relevant position;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
e
paragraph.content: considering whether a person should be appointed as a member of a relevant body, where some or all of the members of that body are appointed; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: considering whether a person should be appointed to a relevant position, approved as a member of a relevant body or recognized as holding a relevant position.

subsection.content: This section shall have effect, notwithstanding the provisions of any Ordinance which provide that a person of a particular sex or marital status is not eligible to stand for election, or to be selected for, a relevant body or position, or to vote in elections for or to take part in the selection of members of a relevant body or the holder of a relevant position.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in the Heung Yee Kuk Ordinance (Cap. 1097) or in any other Ordinance, the Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs shall not— (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a certificate recognizing a body as a Rural Committee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: approve a person as a Special or Co-opted Councillor,

subsection.continued: where that person or body (or any of its members) has been elected or otherwise chosen by a procedure in which women have not been able to participate on equal terms with men, whether as candidates, nominees, electors or in some other relevant capacity.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Discrimination by, or in relation to, barristers

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a barrister or barrister’s clerk, in relation to any offer of a pupillage or tenancy, to discriminate against a woman—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the arrangements which are made for the purpose of determining to whom it should be offered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of any terms on which it is offered; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting, to offer it to her.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a barrister or barrister’s clerk, in relation to a woman who is a pupil or tenant in the chambers concerned, to discriminate against her—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of any terms applicable to her as a pupil or tenant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the opportunities for training, or gaining experience, which are afforded or denied to her;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the benefits, facilities or services which are afforded or denied to her; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by terminating her pupillage or by subjecting her to any pressure to leave the chambers or other detriment.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for any person, in relation to the giving, withholding or acceptance of instructions to a barrister, to discriminate against a woman.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: barrister’s clerk (大律師書記) includes any person carrying out any of the functions of a barrister’s clerk;
pupil (見習大律師), pupillage (見習職位), tenancy (租賃) and tenant (承租人) have the meanings commonly associated with their use in the context of a set of barristers’ chambers.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club to discriminate against a woman who is not a member of the club—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by refusing or failing to accept her application for membership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms or conditions on which the club is prepared to admit her to membership.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club to discriminate against a woman who is a member of the club—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms or conditions of membership that are afforded to her;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or failing to accept her application for a particular class or type of membership;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by denying her access, or limiting her access, to any benefit, service or facility provided by the club;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by depriving her of membership or varying the terms of membership; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by subjecting her to any other detriment.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (1)(b) or (2) renders it unlawful to discriminate against a woman if the discrimination occurs in relation to the use or enjoyment of any benefit provided by the club where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is not practicable for the benefit to be used or enjoyed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: simultaneously; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to the same extent,

paragraph.continued: by both men and women; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the same, or an equivalent, benefit is provided for the use of men and women separately from each other; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: men and women are each entitled to a fair and reasonable proportion of use and enjoyment of the benefit.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), without prejudice to the operation of the other provisions of this Part in relation to the Government, it is unlawful for the Government to discriminate against a woman in the performance of its functions or the exercise of its powers.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not render unlawful—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as regards a woman not having the right to enter and remain in Hong Kong, any act done under any immigration legislation governing entry into, stay in and departure from Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any act done in relation to a woman if it was necessary for that act to be done in order to comply with a requirement of an existing statutory provision.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a person who is, or is a member of, the responsible body for an educational establishment to harass a woman who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of the establishment.
It is unlawful for a person who is a member of the staff of an educational establishment to harass a woman who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of the establishment.
It is unlawful for a person who is a student of an educational establishment to harass a woman who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of the establishment.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of an educational establishment to harass a woman— (Amended 3 of 2021 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is, or is a member of, the responsible body for; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is a member of the staff of,

subsection.continued: the establishment.

section.name: s39A
section.heading: Harassment by clubs
section.content: It is unlawful for a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club to harass a woman who is, or has applied to be, a member of the club.

subsection.leadIn:
It is unlawful for a person to
harass a woman in the course of offering to provide, or providing, goods, facilities or services to her.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn:
It is unlawful for a person to
harass a woman in the course of— (Amended 3 of 2021 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: seeking to be provided with goods, facilities or services by her; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being provided with goods, facilities or services by her. (Added 19 of 2014 s. 3)

subsection.content:
It is unlawful for a person, in relation to premises in Hong Kong of which he has power to dispose, to
harass a woman in the course of offering to provide, or providing, those premises to her.

It is unlawful for a person, in relation to premises managed by him, to
harass a woman occupying the premises.

Where the licence or consent of the landlord or of any other person is required for the disposal to any person of premises in Hong Kong comprised in a tenancy, it is unlawful for the landlord or other person to
harass a woman seeking the licence or consent for disposal of the premises to her.
Section 30(4) shall apply to subsection (4) as it applies to section 30.

subsection.leadIn:
It is unlawful for a barrister or barrister’s clerk, in relation to any chambers, to
harass a woman— (Amended 3 of 2021 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the course of offering to provide to her pupillage or tenancy in the chambers; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is a pupil or tenant in the chambers.

subsection.content:
It is unlawful for any person, in the course of the giving, withholding or acceptance of instructions to a barrister, to
harass a woman who is a barrister.
Section 36(4) shall apply to subsections (6) and (7) as it applies to section 36.

subsection.leadIn: Section 28(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not apply to goods, facilities or services outside Hong Kong except as provided in subsections (2) and (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not apply to facilities by way of banking or insurance or for grants, loans, credit or finance, where the facilities are for a purpose to be carried out, or in connection with risks wholly or mainly arising, outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: Section 28(1) applies to the provision of facilities for travel outside Hong Kong where the refusal or omission occurs in Hong Kong or on a ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft referred to in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: Section 28(1) applies on and in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any ship registered in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: any ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft belonging to or possessed by the Government,

subsection.continued: even if the ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft is outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: This section shall not render unlawful an act done in or over a place outside Hong Kong, or in or over that place’s territorial waters, if any, for the purpose of complying with the laws of that place.

subsection.leadIn: Section 25 shall not apply to benefits, facilities or services outside Hong Kong except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: travel on a ship registered in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: benefits, facilities or services provided on a ship so registered.

subsection.content: Section 40(1) and (1A) does not apply to harassment that occurs outside Hong Kong except as provided in subsection (7). (Added 19 of 2014 s. 4. Amended 3 of 2021 s. 12)

Section 40(1) and (1A) applies to harassment that occurs on a ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft referred to in subsection (3) even if it is outside Hong Kong. (Added 19 of 2014 s. 4. Amended 3 of 2021 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: discriminatory practice (歧視性的做法) means the application of a requirement or condition—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that results in an act of discrimination which is unlawful by virtue of any provision of Part 3 or 4 as read with section 5(1)(b), 7(1)(b), 8(b) or 8A(1)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that would be likely to result in such an act of discrimination if the persons to whom it is applied were not all of the same sex. (Replaced 8 of 2020 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: A person acts in contravention of this section if and so long as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he applies a discriminatory practice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he operates practices or other arrangements which in any circumstances would call for the application by him of a discriminatory practice.

subsection.content: Proceedings in respect of a contravention of this section shall be brought only by the Commission in accordance with the provisions of sections 77, 78, 79, 80 and 81.

It is unlawful to publish or cause to be published an advertisement which indicates, or might reasonably be understood as indicating, an intention by a person to do any act which is or might be unlawful by virtue of Part 3 or 4.
Subsection (1) shall not apply to an advertisement if the intended act would not in fact be unlawful.

For the purposes of subsection (1), use of a job description which is sex specific shall be taken to indicate an intention to discriminate, unless the advertisement contains an indication to the contrary.

subsection.leadIn: The publisher of an advertisement made unlawful by subsection (1) shall not be subject to any liability under that subsection in respect of the publication of the advertisement if he proves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the advertisement was published in reliance on a statement made to him by the person who caused it to be published to the effect that, by reason of the operation of subsection (2), the publication would not be unlawful; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it was reasonable for him to rely on the statement.

subsection.content: A person who knowingly or recklessly makes a statement of the kind referred to in subsection (4) which in a material respect is false or misleading commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Instructions to discriminate
section.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who has authority over another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with whose wishes that other person is accustomed to act,

section.continued: to instruct him to do any act which is unlawful by virtue of Part 3 or 4, or procure or attempt to procure the doing by him of any such act.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful to induce, or attempt to induce, a person to do any act which contravenes Part 3 or 4 by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing or offering to provide him with any benefit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subjecting or threatening to subject him to any detriment.

subsection.content: An offer or threat is not prevented from falling within subsection (1) because it is not made directly to the person concerned, if it is made in such a way that he is likely to hear of it.

Anything done by a person in the course of his employment shall be treated for the purposes of this Ordinance as done by his employer as well as by him, whether or not it was done with the employer’s knowledge or approval.

Anything done by a person as agent for another person with the authority (whether express or implied, and whether precedent or subsequent) of that other person shall be treated for the purposes of this Ordinance as done by that other person as well as by him.

In proceedings brought under this Ordinance against any person in respect of an act alleged to have been done by an employee of his it shall be a defence for that person to prove that he took such steps as were reasonably practicable to prevent the employee from doing that act, or from doing in the course of his employment acts of that description.
For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that this section shall not apply for the purposes of any criminal proceedings.

section.name: s46A
section.heading: Liability of persons engaging interns and volunteers

subsection.content: This section applies for the purposes of section 23A.
For the avoidance of doubt, this section does not apply for the purposes of any criminal proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: An act done by an intern in the course of an internship is to be treated as an act done—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the intern; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the person who engaged the intern for the internship, whether or not the act was done with the knowledge or approval of that person.
