schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Provisions with Respect to the Commission and Committees and their Members

section.name: s1
section.heading: Terms and conditions of appointment of Chairperson, etc.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Chief Executive shall determine the remuneration and the terms and conditions of appointment of the Chairperson. (Amended 66 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: The Chairperson shall not, without the specific approval of the Chief Executive— (Amended 66 of 1999 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: hold any office of profit other than his office as Chairperson; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: engage in any occupation for reward outside the functions of his office.

subsection.content: This section shall apply to any other member of the Commission who is appointed on a full-time basis as it applies to the Chairperson.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Terms of appointment of members of Commission

subsection.content: Subject to sections 1 and 5 and subsection (2), a member of the Commission shall hold and vacate his office in accordance with the terms of his appointment and shall, on ceasing to be a member, be eligible for reappointment.
A member of the Commission shall be appointed for a term not exceeding 5 years.
A member of the Commission may at any time by notice in writing to the Chief Executive resign his office. (Amended 66 of 1999 s. 3)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Members of Commission to disclose interests in respect of certain contracts

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Commission who is in any way directly or indirectly interested in a contract made or proposed to be made by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a committee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an employee or agent of the Commission,

subsection.continued: shall disclose the nature of his interest at a meeting of the Commission.

subsection.content: The Commission shall record the disclosure in the minutes of the meeting of the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: A member who has an interest in a contract referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not without the permission of the Chairperson or other member presiding take any part in any deliberation of the Commission with respect to that contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not in any event vote on any matter concerning it.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), a member may give a notice in writing at a meeting of the Commission to the effect that he is a member of a company or firm and is to be regarded as interested in any contract which may, after the date of the notice, be made with the company or firm and the notice shall be regarded as a sufficient disclosure of his interest in relation to any contract so made or proposed to be so made.

A member of the Commission need not attend in person at a meeting of the Commission to make a disclosure which he is required to make under this section if he takes reasonable steps to secure that the disclosure is made by a notice in writing which is brought up and read at the meeting.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Fees and allowances payable to members of Commission
section.content: The Commission may pay its members such fees and allowances as the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs, after consulting with the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, determines.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Chief Executive may in certain circumstances declare office of member of Commission to be vacant
section.leadIn: If the Chief Executive is satisfied that a member of the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been absent from 3 consecutive meetings of the Commission without the permission of the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt or made an arrangement with his creditors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to discharge the functions of a member,

section.continued: the Chief Executive may declare his office as a member of the Commission to be vacant, and shall notify the fact in such manner as the Chief Executive thinks fit; and upon such declaration the office shall become vacant.

subsection.content: The quorum of the Commission shall be not less than half the members thereof for the time being and, while a member is disqualified from taking part in a decision or deliberation of the Commission in respect of a matter, he shall be disregarded for the purpose of constituting a quorum of the Commission for deciding, or deliberating on, that matter.

All matters for determination at a meeting of the Commission shall be decided by a majority of votes of the members present and voting and where there is an equality of votes the Chairperson or other member presiding shall have a casting vote in addition to his original vote.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Fixing of seal of Commission
section.leadIn: The fixing of the seal of the Commission shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: authorized by the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: authenticated by the signatures of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Chairperson; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other member of the Commission authorized by the Commission, either generally or specifically, to act for that purpose.

subsection.content: The Commission may make and execute any document in the performance of its functions or the exercise of its powers or in connection with any matter reasonably incidental to or consequential upon the performance of its functions or the exercise of its powers.
Any document purporting to be executed under the seal of the Commission shall be admitted in evidence and shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be deemed to have been duly executed.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Certain documents not required to be sealed
section.content: Any contract or instrument which, if entered into or executed by a person not being a body corporate, would not be required to be under seal may be entered into or executed on behalf of the Commission by any member of the Commission generally or specifically authorized by the Commission for that purpose.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Procedure of Commission
section.content: Subject to the provisions of this Schedule, the Commission shall have power to regulate its own procedure including the manner in which decisions of the Commission may be made by a quorum of its members otherwise than at a meeting of the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the remuneration and the terms and conditions of employment of its employees; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the standards of work and conduct of its employees, and matters relating to their suspension or dismissal from office.

subsection.content: The Commission shall determine the remuneration and the terms and conditions of engagement of technical and professional advisers, and of conciliators, and the manner of their engagement.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant, or make provision for the grant of, pensions, gratuities and retirement benefits to employees;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide other benefits for the welfare of employees and their dependants;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: authorize payments, whether or not legally due, to the personal representatives of a deceased employee or to any person who was dependent on such employee at his death.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establish, manage and control; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter into an arrangement with any company or association for the establishment, management and control by that company or association either alone or jointly with the Commission of,

subsection.continued: any fund or scheme for the purpose of providing for the pensions, gratuities, benefits and payments referred to in subsection (3).

subsection.content: The Commission may make contributions to and may require employees to make contributions to any fund or scheme referred to in subsection (4).

subsection.def: In this section employees (僱員) includes any class of employee which the Commission specifies and in subsection (3) includes former employees.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may appoint members of the Commission, and persons who are not such members, to be members of a committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall appoint the chairman of a committee and determine the number of members of a committee.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Members of committee to disclose interests in respect of certain contracts

subsection.leadIn: A member of a committee who is in any way directly or indirectly interested in a contract made or proposed to be made by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the committee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an employee or agent of the Commission,

subsection.continued: shall disclose the nature of his interest at a meeting of the committee.

subsection.content: The committee shall record the disclosure in the minutes of the meeting of the committee.

subsection.leadIn: A member who has an interest in a contract referred to subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not without the permission of the chairperson of the committee or other member presiding take any part in any deliberation of the committee with respect to that contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not in any event vote on any matter concerning it.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), a member may give a notice in writing at a meeting of a committee to the effect that he is a member of a company or firm and is to be regarded as interested in any contract which may, after the date of the notice, be made with the company or firm and the notice shall be regarded as a sufficient disclosure of his interest in relation to any contract so made or proposed to be so made.

A member of a committee need not attend in person at a meeting of the committee to make a disclosure which he is required to make under this section if he takes reasonable steps to secure that the disclosure is made by a notice in writing which is brought up and read at the meeting.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Fees and allowances payable to members of committee

subsection.content: The Commission may pay to the members of a committee such fees and allowances as the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs, after consulting with the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, determines.

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of this section shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not apply in the case of any member of a committee who is a public officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: apply in the case of a member of a committee who is a member of the Commission only to such extent as the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs, after consulting with the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, determines.

subsection.leadIn: The resources of the Commission shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: all money—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: paid by the Government to the Commission and appropriated for that purpose by the Legislative Council; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: otherwise provided to the Commission by the Government; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all other money and property, including gifts, donations, fees, rent, interest and accumulations of income received by the Commission.

subsection.content: The Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury may give directions in writing of a general or specific character to the Commission in relation to the amount of money which may be expended by the Commission in any financial year and the Commission shall comply with those directions. (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002)
Subject to subsection (2), the Commission may borrow by way of overdraft such money as it may require for meeting its obligations or performing its functions under this Ordinance.

The Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs may, after consulting with the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, give directions in writing of a general or specific character to the Commission in relation to the amount of money which may be borrowed under subsection (1) and the Commission shall comply with those directions. (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007)

The Commission may with the approval of the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs given after the Secretary has consulted with the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury borrow, otherwise than by way of overdraft, such money as it may require for meeting its obligations or performing its functions under this Ordinance. (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007)

A person lending money to the Commission shall not be concerned to inquire whether the borrowing of the money is legal or regular or whether the money raised has been properly applied and shall not be prejudiced by any illegality or irregularity or by misapplication or non-application of the money.
Subject to subsection (2), the Commission may invest money that is not immediately required to be expended.

The Commission shall not invest money pursuant to subsection (1) except in such forms of investment as the Secretary for Constitutional and Mainland Affairs, after consulting with the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, approves. (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Accounts, audit and annual report of Commission

subsection.content: The Commission shall cause proper accounts to be kept of all its financial transactions.

The Commission shall, as soon as practicable after the expiry of a financial year, prepare a statement of the accounts of the Commission, which statement shall include an income and expenditure account and a balance sheet.

The Commission shall appoint an auditor who shall, as soon as practicable, audit the accounts required under subsection (1) and the statement of accounts required under subsection (2) and shall submit a report on the statement to the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall, as soon as practicable and in any case not later than 9 months after the expiry of a financial year (or such further period as the Chief Secretary for Administration allows), furnish—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a copy of the statement of accounts required under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the auditor’s report on the statement,

subsection.continued: to the Chief Secretary for Administration who shall cause the same to be tabled in the Legislative Council. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

subsection.content: The Director of Audit may, in respect of any financial year, conduct an examination into the economy, efficiency and effectiveness with which the Commission has expended its resources in performing its functions and exercising its powers.

Subject to subsection (3), the Director of Audit shall have a right of access at all reasonable times to all such documents as he may reasonably require for conducting an examination under this section and shall be entitled to require from any person holding or being accountable for any such document such information and explanation as he considers reasonably necessary for that purpose.
Subsection (2) applies only to documents in the custody and control of the Commission.

Without prejudice to the power of the Director of Audit to conduct an examination under this section, this section applies to any sum of money paid by the Commission in the exercise of its power under section 65(1) of this Ordinance.
Subsection (1) shall not operate to entitle the Director of Audit to question the merits of the policy objectives of the Commission.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Exemption from taxation
section.content: The Commission shall be exempt from taxation under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112).

section.name: s21
section.heading: Provisions to which section 67(1) shall not apply
section.content: Sections 4, 11(1)(a), (4) and (5), 16(1) and (3), 17(1) and 18 shall not be subject to section 67(1) of this Ordinance.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Section 16 of this Ordinance shall not apply, in respect of any organization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to contributions or other payments falling to be made to the organization by its members or by persons seeking membership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to financial benefits accruing to members of the organization by reason of their membership,

section.continued: where the payment falls to be made, or the benefit accrues, as the case may be—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: under rules of the organization made before this Ordinance was enacted; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: before the 3rd anniversary of the day on which that section comes into operation.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: Until the 3rd anniversary of the day on which section 16 of this Ordinance comes into operation*, section 16(2) of this Ordinance shall not apply to any organization of members of the teaching profession where on the enactment of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the organization is an incorporated company with articles of association;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the articles of association restrict membership to persons of one sex (disregarding any minor exceptions); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there exists another organization to which paragraphs (a) and (b) apply which is for persons of the opposite sex and has objects, as set out in the articles of association, which are substantially the same as those of the first-mentioned organization, subject only to differences consequential on the difference of sex. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s3
section.content: If the responsible body for any educational establishment which (apart from this section) would be required to comply with the provisions of section 25(b) of this Ordinance from the commencement* of those provisions, is of the opinion that it would be impracticable for it to do so, it may before that commencement serve on the Commission a notice referred to in section 27(1) of this Ordinance as if that opinion were a determination referred to in section 27(1) of this Ordinance and, in any such case, the provisions of section 27 of this Ordinance shall, with all necessary modifications, apply as if such opinion were such a determination.
